intro: Ricinocarpos velutinus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Ricinocarpos velutinus is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain areas.
